Package bcu.cmp5332.librarysystem.commands

Class RenewBook

java.lang.Object
bcu.cmp5332.librarysystem.commands.RenewBook
All Implemented Interfaces:
Command
public class RenewBook
extends java.lang.Object
implements Command
Renews a book that is already on loan to a patron.

It is an implementation of the Command interface and its execute(Library, LocalDate) method renews (changes) the due date of a Book that is currently on loan to a Patron.

It is created and executed by the CommandParser when the "renewbook" command is given by the user.

The class has a constructor to initialise the fields needed to execute the command.

See Also:
Command, execute(Library, LocalDate), Book, Patron, CommandParser, RenewBook(int, int)

  • Constructor Details

    • RenewBook

      public RenewBook​(int patronId, int bookId)
      Create a new RenewBook instance.

      The constructor initialises a RenewBook object using the fields needed for renewing the due date of a book that is on loan to a patron.

      Parameters:
      patronId - the id of the patron that has borrowed the book
      bookId - the id of the book whose due date will be renewed

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public void execute​(Library library, java.time.LocalDate currentDate) throws LibraryException
      Renew the due date of a book that is on loan.

      The method should calculate the new due date of the book based on the predefined loan period and the current due date and then set the new due date using the appropriate method implemented in the Patron class. After the successful renewal, the method should display a message to notify the user about the new due date.

      The method should throw an exception if there is an error during the execution or if the given book or patron do not exist in the library.

      Specified by:
      execute in interface Command
      Parameters:
      library - -
      currentDate - -
      Throws:
      LibraryException - if there is an error during the execution
      See Also:
      Library, LocalDate, BorrowBook, ReturnBook
